statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ 7 \\ -6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -12 \\ 8 \\ 14 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 13 \\ -10 \\ -17 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -32 \\ 24 \\ 41 \\ -12 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 8 \\ 7 \\ -6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 2 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -12 \\ 8 \\ 14 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 13 \\ -10 \\ -17 \\ 5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -32 \\ 24 \\ 41 \\ -12 \end{array}\right].
